name: DMV Reduced-Fee ID Card
description: Reduced-fee state ID for eligible residents using form DL 937
fullDescription: The California Department of Motor Vehicles offers reduced-fee identification cards for income-eligible residents, providing an affordable way to obtain government-issued photo ID.
whatTheyOffer:
- Reduced-fee state ID card (regularly $35, reduced to $8)
- Valid government-issued photo identification
- Can be used for identification purposes, voting, and more
- Available to qualifying low-income residents
howToGetIt:
1. Contact your county's Public Assistance Agency or social services office
2. Request Form DL 937 (Fee Waiver Certification)
3. Agency will verify your eligibility and complete the form
4. Take the certified DL 937 form to any DMV office
5. Complete ID card application and pay reduced fee
keywords: DMV, ID card, identification, reduced fee, low-income, DL 937, state ID, photo ID, public assistance
